Description: Your expertise in alchemy allows you to create powerful potions and elixirs. You gain proficiency in Alchemist's Supplies(and start with them) and can create potions with greater efficiency.
Your experience in planning and executing strategies makes you a formidable leader. You gain proficiency in Strategy and a bonus to initiative rolls for yourself and your allies.

You specialize in magic duels and you have fought many other mages in your life. You are given a second implement and an extra spellbook to start with. There is a chance of running into a former mage rival from your dueling days.
You start with a worldly artifact.
Your experience in war zones has honed your medical skills. You gain proficiency in Healing, and Herbology and have advantage to stabilize dying characters more effectively.
You have hunted and defeated a dangerous beast. You gain a a set of items from that specific beast that set you apart from other hunters.
You like fighting the undead, so muh so you've devoted much of your spare time to routing them out. Gain Holy Vials, and Occult knowledge

You have navigated the treacherous paths of the Corridors. You’ve been touched by that accursed place and have been given a strange ailment but it grants great power. It is up to you to heal it or let it progress. Also provides a bonus to Stealth skill.

You have slain a Drake, whether you were alone or not it’s a feat in itself to combat one of these beasts. You can gain a Trophy trinket according to the drake you fought, or you can gain a bonus to fighting and dealing with drake attacks.
You like taking on dungeons. This pursuit has its costs but you've delved deep and your careful preperation has rewarded you, start with Dungeoning pack, and adventuring pack.

While others dabble in other elements you found a particular affinity called to you far greater than the others and you developed a deep connection to it, it provides 4 variation spells on one type, but due to this sole focus you lose a starting spell book.
You took on a goblin camp at some point and took on the leader head on and came out victorious, Goblins fear your name and will target you specifically.

During your early life you managed to best a beast that attacked you from the river, and saved the lives of several others. This encounter left you with a wicked scar and caught the eye of an old riverman who taught you the ways of river fishing and boating. Gain the piloting (boats) skill, the fishing skill, and nature practical knowledge.
Knowledge and use of runes, you can understand the runes better and can also dabble in runic arts. Can create rune stones
You have lived through a siege, learning how to endure and adapt. You gain proficiency in Endurance and a bonus to checks related to surviving harsh conditions.

Your acts of bravery in battle have made you a legend. You gain proficiency in Intimidation and Leadership, and you can inspire allies with your presence, granting them a bonus to their rolls once a day.
Your tracking skills are exceptional. You gain proficiency in Hunting and can track creatures more easily, even in difficult terrain and most bad conditions.

This is something that you’ve picked up from those around you. You find the unique quirks of other races and decided that you could use them. For instance, you grew up around humans and learned their skills with their pole arms. Gain one other race’s feasible skill.

Your ancestry grants you unique abilities. Choose an ancient race or being (dragon, celestial, fiend, etc.). You gain a minor ability related to that lineage and advantage on checks related to that heritage.

Your deep studies in arcane theory and its pursuit have given you the chance to obtain a special Spellcasters tome. Also you gain a pen pal who you can send letters to about magical equipment and they can give more details upon their response.
Animals are naturally drawn to you, and you have a knack for understanding them. You gain proficiency in Animal Handling and can communicate simple ideas to animals.

You were drawn to that of smithing and studied under a blacksmith for some time. You have gained the ability to forge your own weapons and have a good understanding of metallurgy. Starts out with a forging hammer.
Blessed by a Fairy, Aedir, or Dryad. These blessings manifest themselves in a variety of ways, but all produce life magic, and some unique variant or lost spell. Gain a powerful White magic spell.
You have a natural connection to a specific element (fire, water, earth, air). You gain that book's corresponding Cantrip book for free, and gain +6 mana.

You picked up some class skills from some other class than what you have chosen. You aren’t sure how you did this but they come naturally to you and although you may have been good in that class, you ultimately decided against it. You gain some skills from another class.

You spent quite some time learning and studying in the local library. You have gained the skills of History and Mythos during your studies. You are able to also find rare books amongst those you find in your adventures.
Born with a heightened draw towards that of magery, you start with more mana than those akin to you.
Raised in a family of warriors, you have trained extensively in combat. You gain proficiency with martial weapons and begin with one for free, as well as a combat proficiency skill.
Growing up as a nomad has made you adaptable and resourceful. You gain proficiency in Survival and an additional language OR a starting mount.
Having spent years at sea, you are adept at navigating and surviving maritime environments. You gain proficiency in Athletics and Seafare, and you can gain your base movement as a swim speed.
Your fascination with mechanical devices has given you an edge in creating and repairing items. You gain proficiency in Tinker's Tools and start with a basic toolkit.

Your expertise with a specific weapon type makes you deadly in combat. Choose a weapon type (sword, axe, bow, etc.). You gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls with that weapon and can perform special maneuvers.
Growing up in the wilderness has honed your survival skills. You gain proficiency in Nature (knowledge and practical) and start with a hunting bow.

you have been graced by a good looking face or body. Many people enjoy being around you due to the way you look. You are able to use this to your advantage to get information or even get favors, depending on how you want to use your omun given skills. Gain advantage on some charisma checks and a boost to your charisma stat.
Take someone’s place when being hit, taking it for them.
Something horrible has happened to you and has left you without something of yourself. Wether you've lost a limb or one of your senses you must carry on. +1 feat
Allows you to use the practical side of knowledge skills, without needing to have that specific proficiency
Be it curse or misfortune the blacks magic of Necromancy and/or Disease have chosen you and bestow a dark power to your disposal. Be wary of their use.

Someway, somehow, you are incredibly……. Not nice to look at. You are ignored by some people and shunned upon by others, whether it was from an accident or a mistake at birth, you are incredibly disfigured. You take a -2 to charisma and gain intimidation instead.
You have learned to be able to tank blows just a little more than you really ought to be able to. You gain the ability to add your constitution modifier to your health twice when leveling up.
You get a -2 int and instead of adding your proficiency, you can subtract it instead and if you succeed, it is treated as a crit.
Sixth sense. Gain insights from dm. Can ask for hints and checks for skills or traps
Your mental fortitude helps you resist attempts to sway or control your mind. You gain a bonus to Wisdom saving throws and advantage on saves against being charmed or frightened.
Your diverse experiences have made you versatile. You gain 3 extra skills.
Whether it be a blessing or just a natural affinity The white magics of healing and Celestia flow to you naturally and powerfully, channeling a tremendous boon to whoever bears their blessing.

Fortune favors you in all things. You are able to get out of situations you shouldn’t normally and you manage to do a few things that some thought near impossible until you did it. At the same time, you have gotten yourself nearly killed and jailed before. Any person may reroll but they must take the reroll.
Trouble follows you wherever you go. Once per day the DM can cause something unfortunate to happen, though since this life of constant misfortune has some benefits, +2 chances, and +10 hp.
You have become quite agile and are able to flit from one place to another. You gain 5 movement speed and proficiency in acrobatics.
You can gain two partial feats from others in your party.
Your reflexes are faster than most. You gain a bonus to initiative rolls and can react swiftly to sudden dangers, granting you a bonus to Reflex saving throws.
You have an innate resistance to certain conditions. You gain a minor resistance to poison and disease, granting advantage on saving throws against them.
Your mysterious background gives you an edge in secrecy. You gain proficiency in Deception and Stealth, and people find it difficult to learn about your history.
Your way with words can sway even the toughest crowd. You gain advantage on persuasion checks and a +2 bonus to your Charisma score.
Your calm demeanor makes you less susceptible to emotional disturbances. You gain a bonus to Will saving throws and advantage on saves against fear spells or effects.
You pick up new skills and knowledge quickly. You gain proficiency in an additional skill of your choice and can learn new languages or proficiencies in half the usual time.
Your skin has become tough through various means, granting you a small amount of natural armor. You gain a +1 bonus to your AC. Also provides a small starting buff to your HP, +10.

You decided to do a tribute to something along your path. This tribute caused you to gain something important or interesting. It could have been something like cold resist, or added strength. Maybe it was gaining an interesting artifact. Either way, you have gained something new from that tribute. In turn, you lose your class given artifact or a debuff in something depending on the power of what you gained.
Your determination allows you to push through pain and hardship. You gain a bonus to Fortitude and Endurance saving throws and can ignore one level of exhaustion once per day.
Your interest in various cultures gives you a broad knowledge base. You gain proficiency in History and an additional language.
Your skills in negotiation and diplomacy are unmatched. You gain proficiency in Persuade and Insight, and can defuse tense situations more easily.
You belong to a prestigious guild, giving you access to resources and contacts. You gain proficiency in one skill related to the guild's focus and can call upon the guild for favors.
Gain alchemy plants every so often while in the wilderness.
Your extensive knowledge of history aids in understanding the past. You gain proficiency in History and can recall historical information with ease. +2 knowledge skills.
Gain bluff
You gain the ability to eavesdrop really well, hearing all the rumors and gaining information you shouldn’t have.
Your deeds have made you a hero in a specific region. You gain a bonus to Charisma checks when interacting with people from that region and can expect help and hospitality there.
You start with an extra spell book and one cantrip book.
Your knowledge of markets and trade routes allows you to get the best deals. You gain proficiency in Appraisal and a bonus to haggling and appraisal checks.
You have a natural talent for teaching others. When you help another character with a skill check, they gain a bonus to their roll. You also gain proficiency in a skill of your choice.
Gain diplomacy and haggling.
You know a lot of people
People want to get to know you
You know how to spread information quickly and effectively. You gain proficiency in Deception and can plant rumors that influence public opinion.
Your time spent navigating city streets has made you an expert in urban environments. You gain proficiency in Investigation and Stealth and can move through crowds without difficulty.
You’ve been around and know a lot of places. Enhanced party traveling speed. Gain skill proficiency in Traveling.
